wikipedia_page.main:
Heitham Al-Sayed (born 27 February 1971) is a rapper/singer from South West London. He is of Saudi and English parentage.
Al-Sayed is lead vocalist in the band Senser, Fiend and (previously) Lodestar. He lives in Paris, France.

response: Senser are a politically charged UK rap rock band, originally formed in South West London from a group of friends in the late 1980s. The initial line-up comprised Nick Michaelson (guitar), Heitham Al-Sayed (vocals), Kerstin Haigh (vocals), John Morgan (drums), James Barrett (bass) and Alan "Hagos/Haggis" Haggarty (engineer, producer, programmer) and in 1992 they were joined by Spiral Tribe D.J, Andy Clinton.Strong, Martin C. (1999) The Great Alternative & Indie Discography, Canongate, , p. 551 The band toured in support of psychedelic rockers the Ozric Tentacles in 1992. In 1993, the band were signed to Ultimate Records.
Lodestar was an English experimental progressive rock band, formed in 1996 by Heitham Al-Sayed (lead vocalist), John Morgan (drums)  and "Haggis" (sound engineer) after they left Senser.

Senser was formed in the late eighties, originally with Kerstin Haigh on lead vocals and, from 1991, Heitham Al-Sayed as the drummer. Al-Sayed moved onto vocal duties when the band covered Public Enemy's "She Watch Channel Zero?!", from that groups influential It Takes a Nation of Millions to Hold Us Back album.

| style="white-space:nowrap;" | Heitham Al-Sayed || Vocals || Senser,Lodestar || multiple || Joined Tool several times at their concerts in London in 1994 and 1997 for "Bottom" and "Pushit" and in Paris in 2006 for "Opiate".

Various musicians have collaborated with Tool in performing "Opiate" live. Examples include Layne Staley in 1993 and '94,Metal News - Tool's Keenan 'Near Perfect' For Alice In Chains ( Metal Underground . com ) Tricky in 2001,The Tool Page: Tour Reviews and Heitham Al-Sayed in 2006.Heitham Al-Sayed with Tool Nu metal band Limp Bizkit has also been known to have covered the song live. (March 16, 2006). Retrieved on August 9, 2008. Keenan has since criticized the band.
